chapter.title: Connecting to a VDB through JDBC
chapter.para: At this point you have deployed Teiid and your VDB. Now it's time to connect the sample application to this VDB, issue SQL queries, and view the returned, integrated data. Note that this process is no different than connecting to any other JDBC source like Oracle.

section.title: Stand-alone Java Application Deployment
section.para: Before you can make a JDBC connection to the Teiid VDB, add the Teiid's driver jar file to your application's classpath

For a Java application to connect to a JDBC source, it needs a URL, user-id, and password. To connect to your VDB all you need is a URL and any additional optional properties that you would like to set. Teiid defaults to allowing the "admin" as user with password as "teiid".
